description.zh-cn: 中国近代启蒙思想家、翻译家，系统地将西方社会学、政治学、政治经济学、哲学和自然科学介绍到中国。
description.en: A Chinese scholar and translator of the late Qing dynasty, best known for introducing Western ideas, including Darwin's "natural selection", to China in the late 19th century.

description.zh-cn: 清朝儒士，曾在严复10岁时担任其家庭教师。
description.en: A Confucian scholar of the Qing dynasty who served as Yan Fu's home tutor when Yan was 10 years old.

description.zh-cn: 由左宗棠设立的中国近代第一所海军学校。
description.en: The first modern naval school in China, established by Zuo Zongtang.

nodes.id: 皇家海军学院 (格林威治)

zh-cn: 皇家海军学院 (格林威治)

description.zh-cn: 位于英国伦敦格林威治的一所皇家海军军官培训学院。
description.en: A Royal Navy training establishment for officers located in Greenwich, London, UK.

description.zh-cn: 清朝外交家，在严复留学英国期间与其结为忘年交。
description.en: A Qing dynasty diplomat who became a close friend of Yan Fu during his studies in the UK.

description.zh-cn: 清末在天津设立的一所海军军事院校，严复曾在此长期任职并担任总办。
description.en: A naval military academy established in Tianjin in the late Qing dynasty, where Yan Fu served for a long time and held the position of superintendent.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国政治人物，曾任总统。早年为严复在北洋水师学堂的学生。
description.en: A political figure of the Republic of China, who served as President. In his early years, he was a student of Yan Fu at the Beiyang Naval Academy.

description.zh-cn: 19世纪末日本侵略中国和朝鲜的战争，中国的战败深刻刺激了严复等知识分子，促使他们寻求救亡图存之道。
description.en: A war in the late 19th century between Japan and China over control of Korea. China's defeat profoundly stimulated intellectuals like Yan Fu, prompting them to seek ways to save the nation.

description.zh-cn: 中国近代思想家、政治家、学者。严复曾资助其创办《时务报》，后在筹安会事件中与严复同为发起人。
description.en: A Chinese thinker, politician, and scholar of the modern era. Yan Fu funded his newspaper 'Shiwu Bao', and they were later co-initiators of the Chouanhui.

description.zh-cn: 由梁启超、汪康年等在上海创办的维新派报刊。
description.en: A reformist newspaper founded in Shanghai by Liang Qichao, Wang Kangnian, and others.

description.zh-cn: 严复等人在天津创办的报刊，宣传变法维新思想，因报道戊戌政变详情被勒令停办。
description.en: A newspaper founded by Yan Fu and others in Tianjin to promote reformist ideas, it was ordered to cease publication for reporting details of the Wuxu Coup.

description.zh-cn: 严复翻译的英国生物学家赫胥黎的《进化论与伦理学》一书，对近代中国思想界产生巨大影响。
description.en: Yan Fu's translation of British biologist Thomas Henry Huxley's 'Evolution and Ethics', which had a profound impact on modern Chinese intellectual thought.

description.zh-cn: 英国生物学家，其著作《进化论与伦理学》被严复翻译为《天演论》，深刻影响了中国。
description.en: An English biologist whose work 'Evolution and Ethics' was translated by Yan Fu as 'Tian Yan Lun', profoundly influencing China.

description.zh-cn: 1898年由慈禧太后发动的政变，结束了戊戌变法。严复创办的《国闻报》因此事被查封。
description.en: A coup d'état launched by Empress Dowager Cixi in 1898, ending the Hundred Days' Reform. Yan Fu's newspaper 'Guowen Bao' was shut down as a result.

description.zh-cn: 中国近代民主革命家，中华民国国父。曾于1905年在伦敦专程拜访严复。
description.en: A Chinese revolutionary, statesman, and founding father of the Republic of China. He specifically visited Yan Fu in London in 1905.

description.zh-cn: 复旦大学的前身，严复曾协助马相伯创办并担任第二任校长。
description.en: The predecessor of Fudan University. Yan Fu assisted Ma Xiangbo in its founding and served as its second president.

description.zh-cn: 京师大学堂于1912年更名而来，即北京大学的前身。严复是其首任校长。
description.en: The name given to the Imperial University of Peking in 1912, the predecessor of Peking University. Yan Fu was its first president.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国第一任正式大总统，后自称皇帝。严复曾支持其复辟帝制。
description.en: The first formal President of the Republic of China, who later proclaimed himself Emperor. Yan Fu supported his attempt to restore the monarchy.

description.zh-cn: 由杨度等人发起，旨在支持袁世凯称帝的政治团体，严复名列发起人之一。
description.en: A political group initiated by Yang Du and others to support Yuan Shikai's accession to the throne, with Yan Fu listed as one of the initiators.

description.zh-cn: 1917年由张勋领导的短暂恢复清朝统治的政治事件，严复对此表示同情。
description.en: A brief political event in 1917 led by Zhang Xun to restore the Qing dynasty, with which Yan Fu sympathized.

description.zh-cn: 1919年在中国发生的一场反帝反封建的爱国运动，晚年的严复对此持反对态度。
description.en: An anti-imperialist, anti-feudal, patriotic movement in China in 1919, which Yan Fu opposed in his later years.

description.zh-cn: 中国教育家，曾任北京大学校长。因支持五四运动中的学生而受到严复的批评。
description.en: A Chinese educator and former president of Peking University. He was criticized by Yan Fu for supporting students during the May Fourth Movement.

description.zh-cn: 清朝外交官，曾接替郭嵩焘任英法公使，批评严复“狂傲矜张”。
description.en: A Qing dynasty diplomat who succeeded Guo Songtao as minister to Britain and France, and criticized Yan Fu for being 'arrogant and boastful'.

description.zh-cn: 中国明清科举考试的一种文体，被严复等维新派人士认为是禁锢思想、摧残人才的制度。
description.en: A literary style used in the imperial examinations in Ming and Qing dynasties, regarded by reformers like Yan Fu as a system that stifled thought and wasted talent.

description.zh-cn: 严复于1895年发表的文章，文中提出了“废八股”的主张。
description.en: An essay published by Yan Fu in 1895, in which he advocated for the abolition of the eight-legged essay.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国时期的一场政治运动，期间严复墓遭到破坏。
description.en: A political movement in the People's Republic of China during which Yan Fu's tomb was vandalized.

location.en: Yangqi Village, Gaishan Town, Fuzhou City

description.zh-cn: 严复及其夫人的合葬墓，位于福建省福州市。在文化大革命期间曾遭破坏。
description.en: The joint tomb of Yan Fu and his wife, located in Fuzhou, Fujian Province. It was damaged during the Cultural Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 严复十岁时，其父邀请名儒黄宗彝到家中教读，黄宗彝成为严复的老师。
description.en: When Yan Fu was ten years old, his father invited the famous Confucian scholar Huang Zongyi to their home to teach him, making Huang Zongyi his teacher.

description.zh-cn: 严复于1867年入福州船政学堂学习驾驶，1871年作为第一届毕业生毕业。
description.en: Yan Fu entered the Fuzhou Naval College in 1867 to study navigation and graduated in 1871 as part of the first class.

relationships.target: 皇家海军学院 (格林威治)

description.zh-cn: 严复于1877年赴英国皇家海军学院学习海军，1879年毕业。
description.en: Yan Fu went to the Royal Naval College, Greenwich in the UK to study naval science in 1877 and graduated in 1879.

description.zh-cn: 严复在英国留学时与时任出使英国大臣郭嵩焘结为忘年交。
description.en: During his studies in the UK, Yan Fu formed a close friendship with Guo Songtao, who was the minister to Britain at the time.

position.en: Chief Instructor of Western Languages, Co-administrator, Superintendent

description.zh-cn: 严复自1880年起在天津北洋水师学堂任教，后升为会办、总办。
description.en: Starting in 1880, Yan Fu taught at the Beiyang Naval Academy in Tianjin, and was later promoted to co-administrator and then superintendent.

description.zh-cn: 黎元洪曾是严复在北洋水师学堂的学生。
description.en: Li Yuanhong was a student of Yan Fu at the Beiyang Naval Academy.

description.zh-cn: 中日甲午战争的失败深刻刺激了严复，战后他在天津《直报》接连发表《论世变之亟》、《原强》等文，主张变法维新。
description.en: The defeat in the First Sino-Japanese War profoundly stimulated Yan Fu. After the war, he published a series of articles in the Tianjin 'Zhi Bao', such as 'On the Urgency of the World's Changes', advocating for reform and modernization.

description.zh-cn: 严复捐款100元资助梁启超与汪康年在上海创办的《时务报》。
description.en: Yan Fu donated 100 yuan to support the establishment of the 'Shiwu Bao' newspaper in Shanghai by Liang Qichao and Wang Kangnian.

description.zh-cn: 1897年，严复和王修植、夏曾佑等在天津创办《国闻报》，宣传变法维新。
description.en: In 1897, Yan Fu, along with Wang Xiuzhi and Xia Zengyou, founded the 'Guowen Bao' in Tianjin to promote ideas of reform and modernization.

description.zh-cn: 严复翻译了赫胥黎的著作并定名《天演论》，于1897年在《国闻报》上连续发表，向中国介绍了“物竞天择，适者生存”的进化论思想。
description.en: Yan Fu translated Huxley's work, titling it 'Tian Yan Lun', and published it serially in the 'Guowen Bao' in 1897, introducing the evolutionary ideas of 'survival of the fittest' to China.

description.zh-cn: 严复深受赫胥黎的进化论思想影响，并将其翻译介绍到中国。
description.en: Yan Fu was deeply influenced by Thomas Henry Huxley's theory of evolution and translated his work to introduce it to China.

description.zh-cn: 《国闻报》因报道戊戌政变的详情，被清政府勒令停办。
description.en: The 'Guowen Bao' was ordered to cease publication by the Qing government for reporting details of the Wuxu Coup.

description.zh-cn: 1905年，孙中山到达英国，特意去拜访严复，二人进行了长时间的会谈。
description.en: In 1905, upon arriving in the United Kingdom, Sun Yat-sen made a special visit to Yan Fu, and the two had a long conversation.

description.zh-cn: 严复曾任复旦公学（复旦大学前身）第二任校长。
description.en: Yan Fu served as the second president of Fudan Public School (the predecessor of Fudan University).

description.zh-cn: 1912年京师大学堂更名为北京大学校，严复任首任校长。
description.en: In 1912, the Imperial University of Peking was renamed Peking University, and Yan Fu became its first president.

description.zh-cn: 严复名列于杨度等人发起的筹安会，该会旨在倡导更改国体，支持袁世凯称帝。
description.en: Yan Fu was listed among the initiators of the Chouanhui, founded by Yang Du and others, which advocated for a change in the form of government to support Yuan Shikai's enthronement.

description.zh-cn: 严复加入筹安会，支援袁世凯复辟帝制。
description.en: Yan Fu joined the Chouanhui to support Yuan Shikai's restoration of the monarchy.

description.zh-cn: 袁世凯死后，大总统黎元洪下令惩办帝制祸首，虽然严复未被通缉，但他也因此前往天津避祸。
description.en: After Yuan Shikai's death, President Li Yuanhong ordered the punishment of the chief culprits of the monarchy scheme. Although Yan Fu was not wanted, he fled to Tianjin to avoid trouble.

description.zh-cn: 严复对1917年的张勋复辟表示同情。
description.en: Yan Fu expressed sympathy for the Zhang Xun Restoration in 1917.

description.zh-cn: 严复在晚年思想趋于保守，对五四运动持批评态度。
description.en: In his later years, Yan Fu's thinking became more conservative, and he was critical of the May Fourth Movement.

description.zh-cn: 严复批评蔡元培在五四运动中支持学生的行为是“不识时务”。
description.en: Yan Fu criticized Cai Yuanpei for supporting students during the May Fourth Movement, calling his actions 'ignorant of the times'.

description.zh-cn: 曾纪泽曾斥责严复“狂傲矜张”。
description.en: Zeng Jize once rebuked Yan Fu for being 'arrogant and boastful'.

description.zh-cn: 严复在《救亡决论》一文中明确提出“莫亟于废八股”的主张，认为其“破坏人才，国随贫弱”。
description.en: In his essay 'On Salvation', Yan Fu explicitly advocated for the 'abolition of the eight-legged essay', believing it 'destroyed talent and led to the nation's poverty and weakness'.

description.zh-cn: 在1970年代的文化大革命时期，严复墓曾遭到破坏。
description.en: During the Cultural Revolution in the 1970s, Yan Fu's tomb was vandalized.
